faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our service

items.question: Can ExcelEasy convert images to Excel?
items.answer: Yes, ExcelEasy can convert images to Excel spreadsheets using advanced AI technology. Simply upload your image containing tabular data, and our AI will analyze and extract the information into a well-structured Excel file. You can also add optional descriptions to help the AI better understand the context and make adjustments to the generated spreadsheet as needed.

items.question: Can AI create an Excel spreadsheet?
items.answer: Yes, AI can create Excel spreadsheets through natural language descriptions. Users can simply describe their requirements in text, and the AI will generate the desired Excel file with appropriate content and formatting. The generated spreadsheets can be further modified and customized as needed. This approach makes spreadsheet creation more intuitive and efficient, eliminating the need for manual formatting and complex formula writing.

items.question: How accurate is the AI Excel generation?
items.answer: Our AI Excel generation is highly accurate and constantly improving. It understands context, formatting requirements, and complex data relationships. However, we always recommend reviewing the generated spreadsheets for your specific needs.

items.question: Can I customize the generated spreadsheets?
items.answer: Absolutely! All generated spreadsheets are fully editable. You can modify formulas, formatting, data, and structure just like any other Excel file.

items.question: What types of Excel functions are supported?
items.answer: We support all standard Excel functions and formulas, including complex mathematical operations, logical functions, lookup functions, and more. Our AI can help you implement and understand any Excel function.

isFree.question: Is ExcelEasy free?
isFree.answer: Yes, ExcelEasy offers a free tier! After logging in, you get 10 free generations per month. This allows you to try out our AI-powered Excel function generation capabilities without any cost.
